GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1932. A private institution. Acquired present status and title 1969
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1878 as Burlington Collegiate Institute and Commercial College, successively renamed Queen City Collegiate Institute and Commercial College 1879, Burlington Business College 1884, Green Mountain College of Commerce 1956, Champlain College of Commerce 1956, acquired current title 1958. Absorbed Woodbury College 2008
Founded 1938 as Secondary School, acquired present status and title 1938
AdmissionRequirements: Graduation from high school or equivalent, and College Board SAT or ACT examination

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1904. A private institution affiliated with the Society of St. Edmund and the Roman Catholic Church

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1834 as Newbury Seminary. Successively renamed Newbury Theological Institute 1841, Springfield Wesleyan Seminary 1846, Vermont Conference Seminary 1865, Vermont Methodist Seminary 1870, Montpelier Seminary 1894, Vermont Junior College 1941, Vermont College 1958, Vermont College of Norwich University 1972, Vermont College of Union Institute and University 2001, acquired current title 2008

Divisions.College: Writing for Children and Young Adults

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1972 as Vermont Law School, first classes held 1973, acquired current title 2022
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: August to May. Also Summer Session (May-July)
AdmissionRequirements: TOEFL test for students for whom English is not the first language

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 2023 through the merger of Castleton University (IAU-002012) established 1787, Northern Vermont University (IAU-009974) - created 2018 through merger of Johnson State College (established 1828) and Lyndon State College (IAU-011117) established 1911 -, and Vermont Technical College (IAU-020861) established 1866.
